function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Changing building materials may not effectively trap the virus and stop the spread of COVID-19","Impact":"Increased risk of COVID-19 spread within the built environment","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough research and testing of building materials to ensure their effectiveness in trapping the virus","Technologies":"Advanced materials testing technologies","People":"Residents, workers, and visitors in the built environment","Owner":"Architects, engineers, and developers"},{"Description":"Lack of specific knowledge about the effects of COVID-19 on building configurations and designs","Impact":"Inadequate measures to prevent COVID-19 spread within the built environment","Mitigation":"Conduct in-depth studies and research on the effects of COVID-19 on building configurations and designs","Technologies":"Simulation tools for studying airflow and virus transmission in buildings","People":"Researchers, architects, and engineers","Owner":"Research institutions, architectural firms, and engineering companies"},{"Description":"Challenges in creating sustainable and energy-efficient building designs that minimize the negative impact on communities and the environment","Impact":"Increased environmental and community health risks associated with building construction and operation","Mitigation":"Use smart designs and existing technologies to ensure energy and resource efficiency, and minimize negative impacts on ecology and communities","Technologies":"Sustainable building materials, energy-efficient HVAC systems, and smart building technologies","People":"Communities, environmental advocates, and construction workers","Owner":"Architects, developers, and construction companies"}]}
